summary: This document is an email chain from July 12, 2019, discussing a potential male victim of Jeffrey Epstein who claims to have information about high-level government figures, including a former president. The email is sent by a former FBI agent to FBI personnel in New York, facilitating contact between the FBI and an investigative journalist friend who is working with the victim. The email also references a deceased retired police officer and the murdered Arkansas Senator Linda Collins-Smith.

persons.name: M. M. In
persons.context: The sender of the initial email, a former FBI agent originally from Newark, who is contacting the FBI New York office to connect them with a potential victim via an investigative journalist friend.

persons.name: SSA
persons.context: FBI Supervisory Special Agent from Squad C-20 (Crimes Against Children/Human Trafficking) at the New York office, who is cc'd on the email and is leading the investigation.

persons.name: ASAC
persons.role: Assistant Special Agent in Charge, FBI
persons.context: FBI Assistant Special Agent in Charge who is cc'd on the email and is involved in leading the investigation.

persons.name: Linda Collins-Smith
persons.context: Referenced as a murdered Arkansas Senator who was briefly in contact with the email sender about a CPS corruption case and had information on child trafficking; her murder is believed to be under FBI investigation.

connections.description: Former FBI agent contacting current FBI Supervisory Special Agent to relay information about a potential victim in the Epstein case.
The email sender was in contact with Senator Linda Collins-Smith for a few months about a CPS corruption case prior to her murder.

events.title: Email referral of potential Epstein victim
events.description: A former FBI agent emails the FBI New York office to connect them with a male victim who claims to have information on Epstein's network and high-level government figures.

events.title: Murder of Arkansas Senator Linda Collins-Smith
events.description: Reference to the murder of Arkansas State Senator Linda Collins-Smith, who had information on child trafficking and whose case is believed to be under FBI investigation.

keyFacts: A former FBI agent refers a potential male victim of Jeffrey Epstein to the FBI New York office, stating the victim has information on 'high level government people; one former president.'
The victim's story was initially being worked on by an investigative journalist and a now-deceased retired police officer specializing in human trafficking.
The email references the murder of Arkansas State Senator Linda Collins-Smith, who had information on child trafficking and was briefly known to the sender.
The FBI's Crimes Against Children/Human Trafficking squad (C-20) in New York is actively involved, with SSA and ASAC leading the investigation.
The communication highlights a channel for victims to contact the FBI via 1-800-CALL-FBI, with calls being tracked and routed to appropriate investigative teams.
